title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide a correct explanation.

  • As the reaction progresses, a lower concentration of the reactant particles remains in the solution, resulting in fewer collisions and a reduced rate of temperature change.

OR

  • As the temperature decreases, collisions between reactant particles occur less frequently and with less force. Since energy must be absorbed for the reaction to occur, having a lower temperature in the solution means fewer particles will achieve the energy requirements to produce products.

The response provides a correct explanation.

  • As the reaction progresses, a lower concentration of the reactant particles remains in the solution, resulting in fewer collisions and a reduced rate of temperature change.

OR

  • As the temperature decreases, collisions between reactant particles occur less frequently and with less force. Since energy must be absorbed for the reaction to occur, having a lower temperature in the solution means fewer particles will achieve the energy requirements to produce products.

title: Part C

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide a correct prediction.

  • Less than. The temperature change will be smaller because less of the limiting reactant is present, resulting in a smaller thermal energy transfer (smaller value of q).

The response provides a correct prediction.

  • Less than. The temperature change will be smaller because less of the limiting reactant is present, resulting in a smaller thermal energy transfer (smaller value of q).
